Patience Philips.Action: Smiles at the cat on the roof, showing a gentle connection to animals.
Is cautious, eager to please, and somewhat of a doormat.

Conceals her looks and wears baggy clothes, possibly indicating insecurity but not directly impacting warmth.
Cautious, eager to please, conceals her looks, described as a bit of a doormat.

Successfully follows through with her plan to visit and inquire about adopting a cat, fills out paperwork.

Attempts to coo at the cat but gets scratched and reacts with a mild expletive.
Recalls and shares relevant personal information with clarity and appropriateness.

Gently strokes Midnight who is snuggling and purring in her lap.
Makes a light-hearted joke about cats staying for free food.
Expresses self-doubt saying 'There's nothing special about me.'
Shows emotional vulnerability when talking about her dead cat, but tries to maintain composure.
Attempts to gently dislodge the cat's claws from her leg and stifles a gasp instead of reacting harshly.

Appears unnerved and unsure when told Midnight has chosen her and seems to doubt her own worth.
Acknowledges her unlikeliness in the eyes of Midnight and expresses self-doubt.
Feels unsure if Midnight the cat likes her, expresses self-doubt.
Keeps numerous photos of family moments and her pet cat displayed in her modest, neat apartment.

Asks for Band-Aids in a somewhat casual manner, implying readiness to handle minor injuries.
Expresses self-doubt by saying 'There's nothing special about me,' despite being perceived as special by others.
Offers the half-empty pint of ice cream to Midnight the cat, allowing Midnight to eat happily.
Jerks back spoon of ice cream from cat initially, saying 'No -- this is mine!'
Watches a handsome man (Tom Lone) from across the way in voyeuristic fashion, acknowledges it as a guilty habit.
Eats chocolate ice cream casually, shares it with the cat, and attempts to watch neighbor discretely by quickly turning off lights and hiding when noticed.
Notices and investigates suspicious expense overage at work, checks details carefully, and reports it to a colleague.
Notices a discrepancy in the accounting data, double-checks printouts to verify the error.
Approaches a colleague to discuss suspiciously high expenses, proactively seeks input.
Spills coffee on her blouse while hurrying to address the issue.
Stares at Georges in disbelief and bolts out into the showroom after being told she must leave because she doesn't represent the company's image.
Shares her insecurities openly with Sally about not being good at traditionally feminine things despite trying, and expresses self-deprecating humor.
Attempts to present herself well by reading Vogue and wearing uncomfortable shoes despite difficulty fitting in the expected image.
Appears overwhelmed and emotionally distressed after being fired, mascara running and nose red, indicating struggle to maintain composure and confidence.
Acknowledges her shortcomings openly and somewhat humorously (e.g., 'Maybe the church needs a new bell-ringer'), showing self-awareness but lack of confidence.
Tells Greta her full name and job position calmly, showing straightforwardness but no notable confidence or assertiveness.
Refuses to return to a job she dislikes despite external pressures.
Engages in casual, friendly banter with Sally, allowing a light, playful moment.
Critically reflects on makeup ingredients, showing skepticism but without malice.
Applies lipstick expertly and uses a smart technique to avoid smearing it on her teeth.
Shows knowledge about the unpleasant ingredients in makeup, indicating awareness and critical thinking.
Dismisses going back to her previous situation without explaining or planning an alternative.
Brings the overproduction and pension fund issue to the attention of management.
Is described disparagingly and unfairly by Georges as sloppy and unappealing, though Berger defends her reliability.
Brings overproduction and pension fund misallocation to attention of accounting and management.
Has sloppy appearance but is reliable and presents accurate information.
Whistles appreciatively at jewelry but expresses dissatisfaction with material things she cannot have.
Refuses to go clubbing, citing unworthiness and self-doubt.
Engages in friendly banter with Sally, showing a close friendship and openness.
Rejects wearing a revealing dress, expressing authenticity and comfort in her own identity.
Wishes to go back to childhood innocence and simplicity, indicating a sincere and reflective nature.
Clambers up a dangerous fire escape to reach Midnight despite the risk, showing care and determination.
Tells Midnight 'You are not worth the trouble' just before the incident, showing some frustration but not hostility.
After falling into the dumpster and being helped by Lone, she silently endures the embarrassing and dirty situation without complaint.
Thanks Lone for helping her after she fell into garbage.
Flirtatiously smiles and cocks her head at Lone.
Apologizes and shows embarrassment about being disgusting after falling into garbage.
Shows a grim, unamused reaction to Sally's laughter at her comment.
Rolls her eyes at Sally but engages in playful banter, showing tolerance of Sally's teasing.
Complains politely about being hurt when pushed and kicked by Randy and Sandy, expecting an apology.
Feels humiliated and bolts when denied entry to the club, showing vulnerability and a sincere response to social rejection.
Tries to maintain composure despite being injured and pushed; tries to reason with the bouncer and suggest Sally go in without her when rejected.
Rolls her eyes and makes a sarcastic comment about Sally's outfit, showing some wit and social awareness.
Bolts out humiliated and does not stand up to the bouncer or assert herself further when denied entry.
Smiles upon seeing Midnight waiting for her, quickens her step toward home.
Sits alone looking at loving couples and sighs, showing loneliness and yearning for connection.
Responds to seeing Midnight in her window with a smile and quickens her step, indicating comfort and reassurance.

Remembers joyful moments from childhood with laughter and playfulness.
Sobs at the sight of two closed coffins, indicating grief and vulnerability.
Struggles with new, overwhelming surroundings and inability to speak human language.
Follows Midnight with growing confidence, adapting to new feline abilities with grace and playfulness.

Rises to get up despite her apparent weak and injured state, attempts to manage on her own.

Immediately apologizes and tries to smooth over the situation after her sudden transformation and hiss.

Reels from recent traumatic events and isolates herself in her apartment's bathroom, avoiding immediate social contact despite knocking and phone calls.
